newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Formulab shares dive on NASDAQ delay.
newsitem.headline: Formulab shares dive on NASDAQ delay.

text.p: Shares in computer group Formulab Neuronetics Corp Ltd dived over 30 percent on Friday after the company's annoucement that its proposed listing on the U.S. NASDAQ had been delayed.
At 2.00 p.m. (0400 GMT), Formulab shares were 12.5 cents or 33.33 percent lower at 25 cents on a turnover of 458,000 shares.
Formulab shares were suspended on Wednesday pending today's announcement.
The company launched its neural PC, the Richter Paradigm Computer, in the U.S. in December 1996. The computer was said to be able to process more complex problems than existing personal computers.
Formulab's share price tumbled shortly after the U.S. launch on media reports of a negative reaction to the launch. The shares hit a peak around A$1.52 in December last year.
